content.description: This route ascends the N. Arete of the Cool Dome Pinnicle.
content.protection: 3 bolts and one FP.  Quick Draws only.
content.location: N. Arete of the Cool Dome Pinnicle.

climbs.name: Stardust Memories
climbs.fa: Troy Mayr, Steve Anderson,Ed Hunsaker and Steve Axthelm

content.description: This is a fun clean smearing route. A great lead for a 5.8 climber working into 5.9's.
content.protection: 5 bolts in a mellow trad spacing.

climbs.name: Rickets And Scurvy
climbs.fa: Troy Mahr, Steve Anderson, and Steve Axthelm, Feb. 1988

content.description: This is a mediocre thin crack route, with a very short tricky section.
content.location: This is near the right end of the wall.  A thin crack leads up to double cracks.

content.description: This tiny but very cool pinnacle is located just up and left from Peril Rock.  The rock goes up the SW arete, and has one bolt on it. There is a crack near the top for added trad protection.   On the summit , the rap anchor has been upgraded with two 3/8 bolts.
content.protection: a piece or two needed to supplement the one  bolt. Small to med.
content.location: Located up and to the left of Peril Rock.

content.description: The right side of the west face has this face to crack route. It has a couple bolts and a couple fixed pins.
content.protection: A light standard rack to 3", 2 bolts, 2 fixed pins.

content.description: This was a fun climb.  It is a great climb to practice OW technique.  I felt it was pretty sustained throughout the offwidth part, so IMO it deserves at least a star.  It eases way up at the top in a fun crack.  It is a little dirty at the bottom, but gets much better after a few moves.
content.protection: This route was a good 5.9 offwidth. The pro is good but you have to be be creative. Bring a standard rack of Cams with no nuts. It would have helped me if I had brought doubles of camalot .75-2.  Bolt anchors on top, but you can also use a camalot 3.5 and 4 if bolts are occupied by someone doing "Bedtime for Democracy". Rap off back side.
